definitions.text: deprive of oxygen and prevent from breathing
examples: Othello smothered Desdemona with a pillow
The child suffocated herself with a plastic bag that the parents had left on the floor

definitions.text: impair the respiration of or obstruct the air passage of
examples: The foul air was slowly suffocating the children
He is suffocating--living at home with his aged parents in the small village

definitions.text: suppress the development, creativity, or imagination of
be asphyxiated; die from lack of oxygen
examples: The child suffocated under the pillow

definitions.text: feel uncomfortable for lack of fresh air
examples: The room was hot and stuffy and we were suffocating

definitions.text: struggle for breath; have insufficient oxygen intake
examples: he swallowed a fishbone and gagged
